commit_message:
Support live migration for macvtap SR-IOV ports

Implements: blueprint sriov-live-migration

Change-Id: I17142387993f51ae7adc90457d07fe322ef804b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/99/141799/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def allocate_pci_devices_for_live_migration(self, context, instance): # With this calling path, the instance has the pci_requests already pci_requests = [] for pci_request in instance.pci_requests.requests: if pci_request.is_new: pci_requests.append(pci_request) if not pci_requests: return if not self.pci_tracker: raise NotEnoughPciDevicesOnDest(host=_("%s") % self.host) try: self.pci_tracker.allocate_for_live_migration(instance, pci_requests) except exception.PciDeviceRequestFailed: raise exception.NotEnoughPciDevicesOnDest(host=_("%s") % self.host) self.pci_tracker.save(context) @utils.synchronized(COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE) def free_pci_devices_for_live_migration(self, context, instance): pci_requests = \ objects.InstancePCIRequests.get_by_instance_uuid_and_newness( context, instance['uuid']) if not pci_requests.requests or not self.pci_tracker: return self.pci_tracker.free_for_live_migration(instance) self.pci_tracker.save(context) @utils.synchronized(COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE)

commit_message:
Correct the spelling for the word constraint

In some places, the word constraint is not spelled
correctly. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I2e581995ed28624d39f59c3cfdda86c4815c4d5f

Adds OS::Keystone::Region resource plug-in

Change-Id: Icaefe55929a1d36614ecdd042e791c1315ecf0ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/13/242013/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from heat.engine.resources.openstack.keystone import region from heat.engine import stack from heat.engine import template from heat.tests import common from heat.tests import utils keystone_region_template = { 'heat_template_version': '2013-05-23', 'resources': { 'test_region': { 'type': 'OS::Keystone::Region', 'properties': { 'id': 'test_region_1', 'description': 'Test region', 'parent_region': 'default_region', 'enabled': 'True' } } } } RESOURCE_TYPE = 'OS::Keystone::Region' class KeystoneRegionTest(common.HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(KeystoneRegionTest, self).setUp() self.ctx = utils.dummy_context() self.stack = stack.Stack( self.ctx, 'test_stack_keystone', template.Template(keystone_region_template) ) self.test_region = self.stack['test_region'] # Mock client self.keystoneclient = mock.MagicMock() self.test_region.client = mock.MagicMock() self.test_region.client.return_value = self.keystoneclient self.regions = self.keystoneclient.regions keystone_client_plugin = mock.MagicMock() self.test_region.client_plugin = mock.MagicMock() self.test_region.client_plugin.return_value = keystone_client_plugin def _get_mock_region(self): value = mock.MagicMock() region_id = '477e8273-60a7-4c41-b683-fdb0bc7cd151' value.id = region_id return value def test_resource_mapping(self): mapping = region.resource_mapping() self.assertEqual(1, len(mapping)) self.assertEqual(region.KeystoneRegion, mapping[RESOURCE_TYPE]) self.assertIsInstance(self.test_region, region.KeystoneRegion) def test_region_handle_create(self): mock_region = self._get_mock_region() self.regions.create.return_value = mock_region # validate the properties self.assertEqual( 'test_region_1', self.test_region.properties.get(region.KeystoneRegion.ID)) self.assertEqual( 'Test region', self.test_region.properties.get( region.KeystoneRegion.DESCRIPTION)) self.assertEqual( 'default_region', self.test_region.properties.get( region.KeystoneRegion.PARENT_REGION)) self.assertEqual( True, self.test_region.properties.get(region.KeystoneRegion.ENABLED)) self.test_region.handle_create() # validate region creation self.regions.create.assert_called_once_with( id='test_region_1', description='Test region', parent_region='default_region', enabled=True) # validate physical resource id self.assertEqual(mock_region.id, self.test_region.resource_id) def test_region_handle_update(self): self.test_region.resource_id = '477e8273-60a7-4c41-b683-fdb0bc7cd151' prop_diff = {region.KeystoneRegion.DESCRIPTION: 'Test Region updated', region.KeystoneRegion.ENABLED: False, region.KeystoneRegion.PARENT_REGION: 'test_parent_region'} self.test_region.handle_update(json_snippet=None, tmpl_diff=None, prop_diff=prop_diff) self.regions.update.assert_called_once_with( region=self.test_region.resource_id, description=prop_diff[region.KeystoneRegion.DESCRIPTION], enabled=prop_diff[region.KeystoneRegion.ENABLED], parent_region='test_parent_region' ) def test_show_resource(self): region = mock.Mock() region.to_dict.return_value = {'attr': 'val'} self.regions.get.return_value = region res = self.test_region._show_resource() self.assertEqual({'attr': 'val'}, res)

commit_message:
Parameter checking for cluster-policy-update

This adds parameter checking for cluster-policy-update. The checks are
actually reusing the same logic as that for cluster-policy-attach.

Change-Id: Id8f8886b25ceb2bb138cf2a2b014db72ae6a3c92
Closes-Bug: #1465620
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/51/249651/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - Added parameter checking for cluster-policy-update API invocation.

commit_message:
Don't reraise the exception in _set_console_mode

As _set_console_mode runs in a thread worker in the backgroud,
there's no way to catch the reraise exception, so change to log
an error message to handle this more gracefully.

Closes-Bug: #1513858
Change-Id: I0df54e6600a47b627d1442e92f80f0ff8654e616

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/55/112655/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. Minimum Scalable HA Setup ========================= OpenStack Queuing Service has two main layers. First one is the transport (queuing application) layer which provides the RESTful interface, second one is the storage layer which keeps all the data and meta-data about queues and messages. For a HA setup, a load balancer has to be placed in front of the web servers. Load balancer setup is out of scope in this document. For storage we will use ``mongoDB`` in order to provide high availability with minimum administration overhead. For transport, we will use ``wsgi``. To have a small footprint while providing HA, we will use 2 web servers which will host the application and 3 mongoDB servers (configured as replica-sets) which will host the catalog and queues databases. At larger scale, catalog database and the queues database are advised to be hosted on different mongoDB replica sets.

Silence most of the deprecation spam

impossible to see what failed in all of the deprecation output.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/62/185162/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def bulk_update(self, operations): """Makes a bulk update patch request. :param operations: Map {<package id>: [(<operation>, <key>, <value>)]} :returns: HTTP response """ url = '/v1/catalog/packages/' data = {} for package_id, package_operations in operations: data[package_id] = ops = [] for op in package_operations: jsonpatch_op = {'op': op[0], 'path': ''.join(('/', op[1]))} if op[0] != 'remove': jsonpatch_op['value'] = op[2] ops.append(jsonpatch_op) return self.api.json_patch_request(url, data=data)

commit_message:
Tarball-constraints should only run on liberty+

'{name}-tarball-constraints should never run on releases prior to
liberty.  Add a broad regex rule to catch this.

Change-Id: Ieee4e1392ffe919eab90b80a702fcca77d333577
Closes-Bug: 1519750
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/73/250073/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: ^.*-tarball-constraints$ branch: ^(?!stable/(?:juno|kilo)).*$

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/99/249899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The Fibre Channel Zone Manager allows FC SAN Zone/Access control management in conjunction with Fibre Channel block storage. The configuration of Fibre Channel Zone Manager and various zone drivers are described in this section. Configure Block Storage to use Fibre Channel Zone Manager ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ If Block Storage is configured to use a Fibre Channel volume driver that supports Zone Manager, update ``cinder.conf`` to add the following configuration options to enable Fibre Channel Zone Manager. Make the following changes in the ``/etc/cinder/cinder.conf`` file. .. include:: ../tables/cinder-zoning.rst To use different Fibre Channel Zone Drivers, use the parameters described in this section. .. note:: When multi backend configuration is used, provide the ``zoning_mode`` configuration option as part of the volume driver configuration where ``volume_driver`` option is specified. .. note:: Default value of ``zoning_mode`` is ``None`` and this needs to be changed to ``fabric`` to allow fabric zoning. .. note:: ``zoning_policy`` can be configured as ``initiator-target`` or ``initiator`` Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Driver ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Driver performs zoning operations through SSH. Configure Brocade Zone Driver and lookup service by specifying the following parameters: .. include:: ../tables/cinder-zoning_manager.rst Configure SAN fabric parameters in the form of fabric groups as described in the example below: .. include:: ../tables/cinder-zoning_fabric.rst .. note:: Define a fabric group for each fabric using the fabric names used in ``fc_fabric_names`` configuration option as group name. System requirements ------------------- Brocade Fibre Channel Zone Driver requires firmware version FOS v6.4 or higher. As a best practice for zone management, use a user account with ``zoneadmin`` role. Users with ``admin`` role (including the default ``admin`` user account) are limited to a maximum of two concurrent SSH sessions. For information about how to manage Brocade Fibre Channel switches, see the Brocade Fabric OS user documentation. Cisco Fibre Channel Zone Driver ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Cisco Fibre Channel Zone Driver automates the zoning operations through SSH. Configure Cisco Zone Driver, Cisco Southbound connector, FC SAN lookup service and Fabric name. Set the following options in the ``cinder.conf`` configuration file. .. code-block:: ini [fc-zone-manager] zone_driver = cinder.zonemanager.drivers.cisco.cisco_fc_zone_driver.CiscoFCZoneDriver fc_san_lookup_service = cinder.zonemanager.drivers.cisco.cisco_fc_san_lookup_service.CiscoFCSanLookupService fc_fabric_names = CISCO_FABRIC_EXAMPLE cisco_sb_connector = cinder.zonemanager.drivers.cisco.cisco_fc_zone_client_cli.CiscoFCZoneClientCLI .. include:: ../tables/cinder-zoning_manager_cisco.rst Configure SAN fabric parameters in the form of fabric groups as described in the example below: .. include:: ../tables/cinder-zoning_fabric_cisco.rst .. note:: Define a fabric group for each fabric using the fabric names used in ``fc_fabric_names`` configuration option as group name. The Cisco Fibre Channel Zone Driver supports basic and enhanced zoning modes.The zoning VSAN must exist with an active zone set name which is same as the ``fc_fabric_names`` option. System requirements ------------------- Cisco MDS 9000 Family Switches. Cisco MDS NX-OS Release 6.2(9) or later. For information about how to manage Cisco Fibre Channel switches, see the Cisco MDS 9000 user documentation.

subject: Bring back Python 2.6 compat (don"t use dict comprehension)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 15:31:20.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/thirdparty/boto/test_ec2_instance_run.py', 'tempest/api/network/test_dhcp_ipv6.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/edee6507df2b73ec76cccc37317581b1741fda2d', 'message': 'Bring back Python 2.6 compat (don"t use dict comprehension)

We have a couple of places where we use dict comprehension. Dict
comprehension are just syntaxic sugar and can be replaced with
dict((k,v) for k,v in iterable) for Python 2.6 compat

I know Tempest doesn"t support Python 2.6 anymore and I agree it's
the good decision. But I am not a fan of "dropping support for the
sake of it", without compeling reason (like using a new module).

I am in charge of a 3rd party CI and my employer wants to have
Centos 6 support for OpenStack Juno. We use Tempest as our non-reg
test suite. Tempest is branchless.

This patch brings back Python 2.6 compatibility.

Change-Id: I23aeafcc9e68d09342a773d2e202f01884080fa3
'}]
commit_message:
Bring back Python 2.6 compat (don"t use dict comprehension)

We have a couple of places where we use dict comprehension. Dict
comprehension are just syntaxic sugar and can be replaced with
dict((k,v) for k,v in iterable) for Python 2.6 compat

I know Tempest doesn"t support Python 2.6 anymore and I agree it's
the good decision. But I am not a fan of "dropping support for the
sake of it", without compeling reason (like using a new module).

I am in charge of a 3rd party CI and my employer wants to have
Centos 6 support for OpenStack Juno. We use Tempest as our non-reg
test suite. Tempest is branchless.

This patch brings back Python 2.6 compatibility.

Change-Id: I23aeafcc9e68d09342a773d2e202f01884080fa3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/75/226375/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Improve swift-init usage statement

Clarify the behavior of strict and non-strict options.

Define what <server> and <config> specify on the command line.

Drive-by fix for missing param in search_tree docstring.

Change-Id: I89fff88a088bc73001464b1fa8240e14a61a117d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/01/249801/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: USAGE = \ """%prog <server>[.<config>] [<server>[.<config>] ...] <command> [options] where: <server> is the name of a swift service e.g. proxy-server. The '-server' part of the name may be omitted. <config> is an explicit configuration filename without the .conf extension. If <config> is specified then <server> should .refer to a directory containing the configuration file, e.g.: swift-init object.1 start will start an object-server using the configuration file /etc/swift/object-server/1.conf <command> is a command from the list below. "missing. Default mode if all servers are " "explicitly named.") "missing. Default mode if any server is one of " "aliases `all`, `main` or `rest`.")
deleted_lines: USAGE = """%prog <server>[.config] [<server>[.config] ...] <command> [options] "missing. Default mode if server is explicitly " "named.") "missing. Default mode if server is one of aliases " "`all`, `main` or `rest`.")

commit_message:
Catch InvalidImageStatusTransition error

Now, when delete image to unallowed status, it will raise a 500
error. So we should catch that error to avoid it.

Change-Id: I47f777a81a6069793dfa4d52eace79edb266669d
Closes-bug: #1505474
(cherry picked from commit 1f8511d8b09c5199a57588e8312a46441fbcd7a6)

commit_message:
Ensure ephemeral user's user_id is url-safe

As a principle, an attribute ``user_id`` should always be url safe and
we should make sure this is the case especially for the federated
authentication workflow as user name and id can be provided directly
from the user (either hardcoded in the mapping rule or passed as a
parameter from the assertion).

Change-Id: I7256a5e4d31d3c2e55fe956fb0170452bb241078
Closes-Bug: #1487115
(cherry picked from commit 02f8576ddf2fca67849171aa7a1b41ebcfa90ded)

added_lines: user_id = user_name user['id'] = parse.quote(user_id)

commit_message:
Show that unscoped tokens are revoked when deleting role assignments

Unscoped tokens should, in fact, NOT be revoked when deleting role
assignments, but this test demonstrates the opposite behavior to be the
case.

Change-Id: Ie4c844b4c2c8dae5d9f6b01404fd153b8155870d
Partial-Bug: 1488208
(cherry picked from commit 5ced3c77430d9a0bd871d5387c9aadb9df1c0060)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/27/222727/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_deleting_role_assignment_does_not_revoke_unscoped_token(self): no_context = {} admin_context = dict(is_admin=True, query_string={}) project = { 'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'domain_id': DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID} self.resource_api.create_project(project['id'], project) role = {'id': uuid.uuid4().hex, 'name': uuid.uuid4().hex} self.role_api.create_role(role['id'], role) self.assignment_api.add_role_to_user_and_project( self.user_foo['id'], project['id'], role['id']) # Get an unscoped token. token = self.controller.authenticate(no_context, _build_user_auth( username=self.user_foo['name'], password=self.user_foo['password'])) token_id = token['access']['token']['id'] # Ensure it is valid self.controller.validate_token(admin_context, token_id=token_id) # Delete the role assignment, which should not invalidate the token, # because we're not consuming it with just an unscoped token. self.assignment_api.remove_role_from_user_and_project( self.user_foo['id'], project['id'], role['id']) # Ensure it is still valid # FIXME(dolph): Due to bug 1488208, the unscoped token is actually # invalid. The assertRaises() should be removed and the token should # validate without error. self.assertRaises( exception.TokenNotFound, self.controller.validate_token, admin_context, token_id=token_id)

commit_message:
Check shellinabox started successfully or not

Shellinabox daemon always return 0 and leave pid file even if it
started failed, so this patch checks whether the process is running.

Change-Id: I1ac32d4b0d0248bdffdce7a7cf88102f58f1c0da
Closes-Bug: #1516897
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/83/246283/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_process_existence(pid): """Check for the existence of a process given its pid.""" try: # Sending signal 0 to a process does nothing, but # will raise OSError if the process does not exist. os.kill(pid, 0) except OSError: return False return True

commit_message:
Set start/stop pacemaker resource timeouts for updates

This matches change I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba, but we
need it to set it before attempting the cluster stop - yum update -
cluster start cycle, to make sure this cycle doesn't hit the low timeout
limits.

This can be removed once updates from deployments made prior to
I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba are no longer supported.

Change-Id: I587136d8d045d213875c657ea5a405074f80c8ad
(cherry picked from commit 5c2d5e335b84485808094173e006e520ccd522db)

subject: Add missing constraints in yum_update.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-16 10:28:58.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/76ec686120393fad89d1ea4b07d84a9340ef9655', 'message': "Add missing constraints in yum_update.sh

Some missing pacemaker constraints were added in the following commits:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219770/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219665/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218931/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218930/

Overclouds that were deployed prior to these constraints being added to
tripleo-heat-templates still have the constraints missing. During an
update, stopping and starting the cluster can fail without these
constraints in place.  As a workaround, conditionally add these
contraints in yum_update.sh so that we're sure they're always present
before updating.

Change-Id: Id46c85dbbe5e85d362279661091b17ce1b697fe0
(cherry picked from commit bfb698e82becf7f53c670618365311029b4f73b8)
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing constraints in yum_update.sh

Some missing pacemaker constraints were added in the following commits:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219770/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219665/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218931/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218930/

Overclouds that were deployed prior to these constraints being added to
tripleo-heat-templates still have the constraints missing. During an
update, stopping and starting the cluster can fail without these
constraints in place.  As a workaround, conditionally add these
contraints in yum_update.sh so that we're sure they're always present
before updating.

Change-Id: Id46c85dbbe5e85d362279661091b17ce1b697fe0
(cherry picked from commit bfb698e82becf7f53c670618365311029b4f73b8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/94/245694/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "Checking for and adding missing constraints" if ! pcs constraint order show | grep "start openstack-nova-novncproxy-clone then start openstack-nova-api-clone"; then pcs constraint order start openstack-nova-novncproxy-clone then openstack-nova-api-clone fi if ! pcs constraint order show | grep "start rabbitmq-clone then start openstack-keystone-clone"; then pcs constraint order start rabbitmq-clone then openstack-keystone-clone fi if ! pcs constraint order show | grep "promote galera-master then start openstack-keystone-clone"; then pcs constraint order promote galera-master then openstack-keystone-clone fi if ! pcs constraint order show | grep "start haproxy-clone then start openstack-keystone-clone"; then pcs constraint order start haproxy-clone then openstack-keystone-clone fi if ! pcs constraint order show | grep "start memcached-clone then start openstack-keystone-clone"; then pcs constraint order start memcached-clone then openstack-keystone-clone fi if ! pcs constraint order show | grep "promote redis-master then start openstack-ceilometer-central-clone"; then pcs constraint order promote redis-master then start openstack-ceilometer-central-clone require-all=false fi if ! pcs resource defaults | grep "resource-stickiness: INFINITY"; then pcs resource defaults resource-stickiness=INFINITY fi

commit_message:
tripleo.sh set priorities for stable repos

Previously we weren't setting any priorities, thus the tripleo-ci
repo was ignored.

Change-Id: Id3d09e5a8e7be0e9e445bf881cb577203e49ea98

commit_message:
Refactor IRMCVirtualMediaAgentDeploy by applying new BootInterface

This patch refactors IRMCVirtualMediaAgentDeploy by applying new
BootInterface. Consequently IRMCVirtualMediaAgentDeploy is divided
into IRMCVirtualMediaBoot and IRMCVirtualMediaAgentDeploy.

Implements: blueprint irmc-driver-uses-boot-interface

Change-Id: I7cae6588dfeffec3c5667ecabdb164ca72d63f22
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/77/221577/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.boot = deploy.IRMCVirtualMediaBoot()

commit_message:
Removes discover from test-reqs

The discover package is part of Python 2.7, so we don't need
to explicitely require it. It's by the way annoying for
distribution package maintainers, as the file has to be
patched.

Keystone team has decided to drop python 2.6 support[1],
so, it's safe to remove it from test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/keystone/2015/keystone.2015-11-24-17.59.html

Related-Bug: #1519449
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Goirand <thomas@goirand.fr>
Change-Id: I5bb258a4b305c0084be50bc22fe7a0e6a4f65aad

commit_message:
Add "httpchk /versions" for glance-api haproxy.

With the default httpchk, glance-api always show warning in the logs
"WARNING glance.api.middleware.version_negotiation [..] Unknown version.
Returning version choices", with the /versions added, there is no
warning in the log.

Change-Id: I086cb23c30b9e3ddc5eac68cba42d03ed907138c
(cherry picked from commit 2a2da2f5aa271eebb06016060c62eee4618a0228)

commit_message:
Remove useless ResourceManager.register_model()

All the d6cage API service objects are contained in
ElementHandler and CollectionHandler, so that isn't
necessary to register model, remove the related logic
and method.

Change-Id: I7cb0bf05085864c77c731869946bcee551228ae1

Now when we create a reactive policy, like:
'execute[nova:servers.pause(x)] :- nova:servers(id=x, status="ACTIVE")',
the tables 'nova:servers.pause' and 'nova:servers' will present in the
output of 'congress policy table list', the user might want to list table
rows by the table 'nova:servers.pause', that shouldn't be supported by
Congress, 'nova:servers.pause' is just a service API or user-defined
function, not a regular table, so filter this type table out from
policy.tablenames(), avoid this operation.

Change-Id: I9846d67dbbb8f808ee5a78d0c3317fd04ac68896

commit_message:
Remove execute table from policy table list

Now when we create a reactive policy, like:
'execute[nova:servers.pause(x)] :- nova:servers(id=x, status="ACTIVE")',
the tables 'nova:servers.pause' and 'nova:servers' will present in the
output of 'congress policy table list', the user might want to list table
rows by the table 'nova:servers.pause', that shouldn't be supported by
Congress, 'nova:servers.pause' is just a service API or user-defined
function, not a regular table, so filter this type table out from
policy.tablenames(), avoid this operation.

Change-Id: I9846d67dbbb8f808ee5a78d0c3317fd04ac68896
Closes-Bug: #1454844
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/34/240634/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_policy_tablenames_filter_modal(self): execute_rule = 'execute[nova:servers.pause(x)] :- nova:servers(x)' run = self.prep_runtime(execute_rule) execute_policy = run.get_target(NREC_THEORY) tables = execute_policy.tablenames() self.assertEqual({'nova:servers.pause', 'nova:servers'}, set(tables)) tables = execute_policy.tablenames(include_modal=False) self.assertEqual({'nova:servers'}, set(tables)) tables = execute_policy.tablenames(include_modal=True) self.assertEqual({'nova:servers.pause', 'nova:servers'}, set(tables))

Remove flake8 test from gate-check-commit

The flake8 test has been moved to tox and its own gate check, so it
may be removed from the gate-check-commit script.

commit_message:
Fix description field in schema for Nova

Currently, description is always None when showing schema of datasource
or schema of particular table of datasource.

This commit only fixes for nova datasource.

Change-Id: I927b4d252fe4be085d5c7a3cdc95e8a68487b9d8
Partial-Bug:#1498398

commit_message:
initialize ceilometerclient when we use it

There is a chance that ceilometerclient cannot be initialized if
keystone is not available, putting the initialization in __init__
will fail to load threshold extension for such case.

This patch moves the initialization out from __init__ to a dedicate
property method.

Change-Id: I24895126c3efe9920390401e4d10a2ce6b1f1376
Closes-Bug: #1518447

commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: Iac16f49b514f41684b319e3d091b52513f721b55
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Pin setuptools == 18.5

Yesterday the new versions of setuptools (18.6 and 18.6.1) were released
where some functionality such as installation in the editable mode was
broken. It will be fixed in the 18.6.2 release.

commit_message:
Add synchronizer for policies and rules

This synchronizer keeps the policy engine's policies and rules in sync with
the database.  With this change, Congress should be able to run policy engine
replicas side-by-side in an high-availability configuration.

Implements blueprint: basic-high-availability
Change-Id: I72d8a9952d8345129656c4a701896614fa837a08

commit_message:
Modularize inventory and add initial testing

The inventory module for bifrost is a vital component, however
as it was developed as a single file and it needs to to be broken
up into a modular chunk in order to have meaningful testing.

Broke into module, symlinking the file into place for now until
documentation and install process can be updated.

Added two basic tests to lay the groundwork for basic testing
of the data parsing and result passing.

Change-Id: I02e79b635202a7933ae641b9d27cc19a75b7bc4f
Partial-Bug: 1499801

commit_message:
Add switch to enable/disable streaming raw images for IPA

This patch is adding a configuration option called "stream_raw_images"
under the "agent" group. By default this option is set to True, meaning
that the IPA ramdisk will be instructed to stream raw images directly
onto the disk instead of copying it to a tmpfs partition prior of
writing it to the disk. By streaming raw images IPA will consume less
memory to run and the deployment will be faster (unless the disk being
deployed is really slow).

Depends-On: Iddf67907bc9b54bbd3065a97064cb5a3602cfe18
Related-Bug: #1505685
Change-Id: I7e7ed7e7aeebbf7c936605a72aa974db2123a43e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/56/246356/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONF.set_override('stream_raw_images', False, 'agent') 'stream_raw_images': False, 'stream_raw_images': True,

Add backup info as part of /mgmt/accounts/<account_id> response.

Change-Id: I795ada4b289b10b2c061ad718fe4d23007d9e0c2

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-specs refs/changes/36/194736/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode Sections of this template were taken directly from the Nova spec template at: https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs/blob/master/specs/template.rst .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst. Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None Note: This comment may be removed if desired, however the license notice above should remain. ============================ Template for New Trove Specs ============================ .. If section numbers are desired, unindent this .. sectnum:: .. If a TOC is desired, unindent this .. contents:: Introduction paragraph -- what is the motivation for the spec/blueprint? (Don't forget to change the title above to something more relevant.) Launchpad Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/account-backups Problem Description =================== Admin user is unable to list backups for a given tenant. Proposed Change =============== There does not seem to a way to list backups for a given tenant. The /mgmt/accounts/<account_id> lists all trove instance ids for a tenant. This should be made complete by also listing all backup ids associated with the tenant. It is useful for admin to get this info in order to reclaim resources for a tenant. https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/trove-specs+message:apiimpact,n,z Configuration ------------- None Database -------- None Public API ---------- None Management API -------------- Impact is to management API for account related information Introduces change to GET HOST:8779/v1.0/<tenant_id>/mgmt/accounts/<account_id> Current response: RESP BODY: {"account": {"id": "4482d3f1f4e24ba08b9dc6649d5df39f", "instance_ids": ["77a82689-f714-465a-a45d-8bd8e1f5eaaf", "a37929d7-dd3e-474d-9eed-5c64b8005457"]}} Proposed response: (includes backup_ids) RESP BODY: {"account": {"id": "4482d3f1f4e24ba08b9dc6649d5df39f", "instance_ids": ["77a82689-f714-465a-a45d-8bd8e1f5eaaf", "a37929d7-dd3e-474d-9eed-5c64b8005457"], "backup_ids": ["197048c1b08545e59ba7633ac9e17b65", "7afed0bc00ef48869ee594e6d3e5173b"]}} Public API Security ------------------- None Python API ---------- Does this change the Python API? If anything was removed, has it been properly marked as deprecated? CLI (python-troveclient) ------------------------ No changes will be required Internal API ------------ None Guest Agent ----------- None Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: - Ramashri Umale (rumale) Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Liberty-1 Work Items ---------- 1. Modify list classmethod to Backup in master/trove/backup/models.py to accept tenant_id parameter and use it as filter only if context is admin 2. Modify trove/extensions/account/models.py __init__ to add backup_ids Also modify load to call above list method and load backup ids 3. Alter the existing unit tests as appropriate. Upgrade Implications ==================== None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Bug  :  Not able to create a resource without sync attribute

description : when user just want to check the limit of quota,
without sync attribute,function gives error.

DocImpact
closes-Bug:1455346
Implements: blueprint Adding cinder qutoa to limit per volume size
Change-Id: I910b5bf8ab936272d793fa8cce9d14e5f1674816

subject: Fix metadata retrieval in GPFS driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-18 11:09:22.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/gpfs.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_gpfs.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/723b6dfba0ee0261002485a1397c5b69a266527c', 'message': "Fix metadata retrieval in GPFS driver

GPFS driver was using 'volume_metadata' to get the
volume metadata. With versionedobjects, it is to be
retrieved using 'metadata' from volume.
This patch fixes the issue. It first tries for 'volume_metadata'
in the volume object, if not present, it will try for 'metadata'
to get the metadata.

Change-Id: I97649874ab54187a469193c8cae773409e9913e6
Closes-bug: 1517404
"}]
commit_message:
Fix metadata retrieval in GPFS driver

GPFS driver was using 'volume_metadata' to get the
volume metadata. With versionedobjects, it is to be
retrieved using 'metadata' from volume.
This patch fixes the issue. It first tries for 'volume_metadata'
in the volume object, if not present, it will try for 'metadata'
to get the metadata.

Change-Id: I97649874ab54187a469193c8cae773409e9913e6
Closes-bug: 1517404

commit_message:
Add availability_zone support for network

This patch adds the availability_zone support for network.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I9259d9679c74d3b3658771290e920a7896631e62
Co-Authored-By: IWAMOTO Toshihiro <iwamoto@valinux.co.jp>
Partially-implements: blueprint add-availability-zone
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/36/204436/35 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from operator import attrgetter from operator import itemgetter net = plugin.get_network(context, net_id) az_hints = (net.get('availability_zone_hints') or cfg.CONF.default_availability_zones) if (az_hints and dhcp_agent['availability_zone'] not in az_hints): continueclass AvailabilityZoneScheduler(object): def __init__(self): self.resource_filter = DhcpFilter() def schedule(self, plugin, context, network): """AZ aware scheduling If the network has multiple AZs, agents are scheduled as follows: - select AZ with least agents scheduled for the network (random for AZs with same amount of agents scheduled) - select agent with least load in the selected AZ (like WeightScheduler) """ filtered_agents_dict = self.resource_filter.filter_agents( plugin, context, network) num_agents = filtered_agents_dict['n_agents'] hostable_agents = filtered_agents_dict['hostable_agents'] hosted_agents = filtered_agents_dict['hosted_agents'] hostable_az_agents = {} num_az_agents = {} for agent in hostable_agents: az_agent = agent['availability_zone'] if az_agent not in hostable_az_agents: hostable_az_agents[az_agent] = [agent] else: hostable_az_agents[az_agent].append(agent) if az_agent not in num_az_agents: num_az_agents[az_agent] = 0 for agent in hosted_agents: az_agent = agent['availability_zone'] if az_agent in num_az_agents: num_az_agents[az_agent] += 1 chosen_agents = [] for _ in range(num_agents): for select_az, _ in sorted(num_az_agents.items(), key=itemgetter(1)): if hostable_az_agents[select_az]: select_agent = sorted(hostable_az_agents[select_az], key=attrgetter('load'))[0] chosen_agents.append(select_agent) hostable_az_agents[select_az].remove(select_agent) num_az_agents[select_az] += 1 break # bind the resource to the agents self.resource_filter.bind(context, chosen_agents, network['id']) return chosen_agents return {'n_agents': 0, 'hostable_agents': [], 'hosted_agents': []} def _get_active_agents(self, plugin, context, az_hints): filters = {'agent_type': [constants.AGENT_TYPE_DHCP], 'admin_state_up': [True]} if az_hints: filters['availability_zone'] = az_hints context, filters=filters) return {'n_agents': 0, 'hostable_agents': [], 'hosted_agents': []} az_hints = (network.get('availability_zone_hints') or cfg.CONF.default_availability_zones) active_dhcp_agents = self._get_active_agents(plugin, context, az_hints) if not active_dhcp_agents: return {'n_agents': 0, 'hostable_agents': [], 'hosted_agents': []} return {'n_agents': 0, 'hostable_agents': [], 'hosted_agents': []} return {'n_agents': n_agents, 'hostable_agents': hostable_dhcp_agents, 'hosted_agents': hosted_agents}
deleted_lines: return {'n_agents': 0, 'hostable_agents': []} def _get_active_agents(self, plugin, context): context, filters={ 'agent_type': [constants.AGENT_TYPE_DHCP], 'admin_state_up': [True]}) return {'n_agents': 0, 'hostable_agents': []} active_dhcp_agents = self._get_active_agents(plugin, context) if not active_dhcp_agents: return {'n_agents': 0, 'hostable_agents': []} return {'n_agents': 0, 'hostable_agents': []} return {'n_agents': n_agents, 'hostable_agents': hostable_dhcp_agents}

commit_message:
Revert "Rename semantic-version dep to semantic_version"

This reverts commit 3d4b27f8554baee165d9984895ca2471d88d6812.

The change is actually opposite what the commit message claims and
will set the wrong name to the requirements.

Change-Id: I1f3f50d584a163bdefbab406d8d67205614746f8

deleted_lines: Heat is a service to orchestrate multiple composite cloud applications using the .. _AWS CloudFormation: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/APIReference/Welcome.html?r=7078 template format, through both an OpenStack-native REST API and a CloudFormation-compatible Query API.

subject: Remove dependency on instance_info for DHCP config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 19:29:45.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic/tasks/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/5e4539f17510392ff2679330686f7e7919784eb8', 'message': 'Remove dependency on instance_info for DHCP config

According to the documentation[1], instance_info variable is used to
define the instance that will be deployed, and has nothing to do with
its networking configuration. It therefore is not sensible to only
allow static DHCP settings for nodes with instance_info defined since
"By default, this is NOT expected to be defined".

Moreover, when the new dhcp-hosts file is created in
bifrost.dhcp-hosts.d/, dnsmasq needs to re-read this directory
regardless of whether instance_info is defined, so it does not make
sense for the "Sending dnsmasq HUP" task to be dependent on
instance_info NOT being defined.

Sending HUP should be safe to do; according to the dnsmasq man page,

  When it receives a SIGHUP, dnsmasq clears its cache and then
  re-loads /etc/hosts and /etc/ethers and any file given by
  --dhcp-hostsfile, --dhcp-hostsdir, --dhcp-optsfile, --dhcp-optsdir,
  --addn-hosts or --hostsdir. The dhcp lease change script is called
  for all existing DHCP leases. If --no-poll is set SIGHUP also
  re-reads /etc/resolv.conf. SIGHUP does NOT re-read the configuration
  file."

This does not imply any disruption of service. This assumption is
consistent with a reading of the dnsmasq signal handling code[2].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/bifrost/tree/playbooks/roles/bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic/README.md#n45
[2] http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~vcs-imports/dnsmasq/master/view/head:/src/dnsmasq.c#L1193

Change-Id: Iae0dae8ad4dd7c9f2263b97875702ed0970761cf

commit_message:
Remove dependency on instance_info for DHCP config

According to the documentation[1], instance_info variable is used to
define the instance that will be deployed, and has nothing to do with
its networking configuration. It therefore is not sensible to only
allow static DHCP settings for nodes with instance_info defined since
"By default, this is NOT expected to be defined".

Moreover, when the new dhcp-hosts file is created in
bifrost.dhcp-hosts.d/, dnsmasq needs to re-read this directory
regardless of whether instance_info is defined, so it does not make
sense for the "Sending dnsmasq HUP" task to be dependent on
instance_info NOT being defined.

Sending HUP should be safe to do; according to the dnsmasq man page,

  When it receives a SIGHUP, dnsmasq clears its cache and then
  re-loads /etc/hosts and /etc/ethers and any file given by
  --dhcp-hostsfile, --dhcp-hostsdir, --dhcp-optsfile, --dhcp-optsdir,
  --addn-hosts or --hostsdir. The dhcp lease change script is called
  for all existing DHCP leases. If --no-poll is set SIGHUP also
  re-reads /etc/resolv.conf. SIGHUP does NOT re-read the configuration
  file."

This does not imply any disruption of service. This assumption is
consistent with a reading of the dnsmasq signal handling code[2].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/bifrost/tree/playbooks/roles/bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic/README.md#n45
[2] http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~vcs-imports/dnsmasq/master/view/head:/src/dnsmasq.c#L1193

Change-Id: Iae0dae8ad4dd7c9f2263b97875702ed0970761cf

commit_message:
Make delete_server() return True/False

To be consistent with our other delete API methods, make delete_server()
return True if the delete succeeded, or False if the server was not
deleted because it was not found.

This also combines the functional testing of create_server() and
delete_server() so that tests are more efficient by eliminating an
extra instance creation. This is in anticipation of adding more
tests that will create server instances and there are only so
many resources available in the test environment.

Change-Id: If1b1a3886df60fb064682caa23113f91b78a4090

commit_message:
VMware: Skip unsupported datastore types

vCenter supports different types of datastores such as
VMFS, NFS etc. Currently the VMDK driver supports only
vSAN, VMFS and NFS datastores for storing volume vmdks.
This patch adds a check to skip unsupported datastore
types during volume creation.

Closes-bug: #1519316
Change-Id: I314abbe0de09bb304859c72b27054784eeef9044

commit_message:
Add 'hw:cpu_threads_policy=separate' scheduling

The 'separate' CPU threads policy requires a host with an SMT
architecture but ensures vCPUs are allocated from non-thread siblings.
This is useful for workloads that may see performance impacts due to
contention.

Change-Id: I18b3a6413450d5f0cbc3eb8e66a2bcda23293478
Implements: blueprint virt-driver-cpu-thread-pinning
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/52/202652/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: usable_cores = map(lambda s: list(s)[:1], sibling_sets[threads_no]) if len(usable_cores) < len(instance_cell): return pinning = zip(sorted(instance_cell.cpuset), itertools.chain(*usable_cores)) return _pack_instance_onto_cores( host_cell.free_siblings, instance_cell, host_cell.id)
deleted_lines: raise NotImplementedError("The 'separate' policy is not supported.") # Instance requires hyperthreading in it's topology if instance_cell.cpu_topology and instance_cell.siblings: return _pack_instance_onto_cores(host_cell.free_siblings, instance_cell, host_cell.id) else: # Try to pack the instance cell in one core largest_free_sibling_set = sorted( host_cell.free_siblings, key=len)[-1] if (len(instance_cell.cpuset) <= len(largest_free_sibling_set)): return _pack_instance_onto_cores( [largest_free_sibling_set], instance_cell, host_cell.id) # We can't to pack it onto one core so try with avail siblings else: return _pack_instance_onto_cores( host_cell.free_siblings, instance_cell, host_cell.id)

commit_message:
Updates REST & RPC abandon API with is_forced=False

Adds the is_forced parameter to abandon_stack to
allow the user to forcefully abandon the stack even
its not exported.

APIImpact

commit_message:
Add script for targeting bugs from the command line

Change-Id: Ief10ee1f03523b7acc05d137b57872dd06f162d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/88/194688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # # Script to set the milestone of Launchpad bugs # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from __future__ import print_function from argparse import ArgumentParser from launchpadlib.launchpad import Launchpad from lazr.restfulclient.errors import ServerError # Parameters parser = ArgumentParser(description="Change Launchpad bug targets") parser.add_argument("--test", action='store_const', const='staging', default='production', help='Use LP staging server to test') parser.add_argument('projectname', help='The project to act on') parser.add_argument('milestone', help='ACTION: set the milestone to specified target') parser.add_argument('bugs', type=int, nargs='+', help='Bugs to update') args = parser.parse_args() # Connect to Launchpad print("Connecting to Launchpad...") launchpad = Launchpad.login_with('openstack-releasing', args.test) # Retrieve bugs print("Retrieving project...") proj = launchpad.projects[args.projectname] to_milestone = proj.getMilestone(name=args.milestone) if not to_milestone: parser.error('Target milestone %s does not exist' % args.milestone) for bug_id in args.bugs: bug = launchpad.bugs[bug_id] for task in bug.bug_tasks: if task.bug_target_name != args.projectname: continue print('%s - ' % bug.id, end='') if task.milestone == args.milestone: print('already set') else: try: task.milestone = args.milestone task.lp_save() except ServerError as e: print('FAILED to update: %s' % e) else: print('milestone updated')

commit_message:
Fix more unhandled errors for full validation

Fix some errors that are not being handled for full validation.
They include some invalid node template and outputs property names,
and references to non-existing node templates. Also, add proper
unit tests.

Change-Id: Idba3382f3c8e1fcf6671a166f21ad003fdfbcc6b
Closes-Bug: #1517728

commit_message:
Use sudo for role testing

There are 2 ways to realize the privilege escalation
needed for the gate jobs.

1) Editing the playbooks (and hope to not forget to
write the sudo/become lines for every role)
2) Editing the inventory and set the variable there.

I'm taking the second approach with the minimum set
of variables (become_method is sudo by default and
become_user is root by default).

Change-Id: I066ac778f7bf3d3f569791e30067bcab4e8eef6b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
SR-IOV: Improve the vnic type check in the neutron api

The Neutronv2 API checks the vnic_type to see whether
or not it should include a PCI requests for SR-IOV ports.
The check is "if the vnic_type is not NORMAL" which is fine
for now that we have only NORMAL, DIRECT and MACVTAP, but in the future more vnic types
can be added. This patch update the check to be what the vnic types
are expecting to be.

Change-Id: I7b8ba1acfbafc3d02ab50afadf4627fcce052484

commit_message:
Adjust conditions when enable_snat is specified

Some clouds barf about policy if the enable_snat attribute is
sent during router creation. Only send it if it is different
from the default (i.e., only when False).

This is a fix for:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/2474

Change-Id: Id656029b9cf593fcb8e0771fa19c567126c565ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/31/249931/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Only send enable_snat if it is different from the Neutron # default of True. Sending it can cause a policy violation error # on some clouds. if enable_snat is not None and not enable_snat: info['enable_snat'] = False
deleted_lines: if enable_snat is not None: info['enable_snat'] = enable_snat

commit_message:
Log debug generated swift temp URLs

Debugging an IPA installation using Swift temp URLs would be
much easier if we simply logged this generated URL in
the conductor log somewhere...

Change-Id: I2ac45b1f27748150257a2d6014b1fb14a8e0cf8c

commit_message:
glusterfs/volume layout: fix incorrect usage of export_location

Actually, all uses of export_location are incorrect -- from the
layout code's point of view, export_location is an arbitrary
opaque value, obtained from self.driver._setup_via_manager with
which the only legit action is to return it from create_share*.

That we use export_location as dict key in ensure_share is just
a pre-layout relict that survived by the virtue of remaining
unnoticed. Now the referred bug forced it out of the dark.

Change-Id: I965dae99486002f00145daff0cd2a848777b5b81
Partial-Bug: #1501670

commit_message:
Fix gate-nova-functional-constraints

Tox runs gerrit-git-prep, however when constraints are used
zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints must be used.  Make a new tox job
template that pulls in the required git-prep and update nova to use it.

Implements Blueprint: Requirements-Management

Change-Id: I59fcf763d7eb9252e950dce5783befc20b4e8fd4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/27/248527/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Declare multiattach is True in LVMVolume driver

An LVM volume can be attached to multi instances, however,
this feature is not declared in LVMVolume driver. As a result,
if a user create a multi-attached volume using LVMVolume as
backend, they will be failed.

In this commit, we declared multiattach is True in LVMVolume
driver.

Change-Id: I66a4d62054fee14da6cf029084074453b30eb1bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/32/249532/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: data["multiattach"] = True

commit_message:
initial spec for kolla rest api client

Change-Id: Icca6e04a45176e5690b18c481216cffa9ae70342
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/17/245917/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================== Provide REST API for Kolla ========================== Kolla provides a mechanism to deploy openstack on containers. Deployment is controlled by the contents of various property files, notably globals.yml and inventory of groups, services, and hosts. The current v2/liberty kolla CLI provides: - view/update properties - update passwords - hosts - add/remove - setup (add kolla user ssh certificate) - groups - add/remove - associate to hosts - services - associate to groups - deploy to specific groups, hosts, services - stop/kill services on host The current plan for v3/mitaka is to add to the CLI: - upgrade/update of specific hosts or groups - validation of properties (eg enable_haproxy: "maybe" would be disallowed) - provide status of services: - per-host status (running/created/paused/stopped/deleted) - per-host version - per-host uptime - view container logs The REST API would support all the features of the CLI. =================== Problem Description =================== kolla is a big step forward in providing an openstack environment that can be deployed and upgraded more easily. However the openstack/kolla environment can be quite complex with services spread across many hosts. When problems arise it can be very difficult to debug them. Some examples: - When there is a problem in a container, it is not simple to debug. Having the ability to fetch or view the logs (whether local on the hosts or centralized via rsyslog) would be very helpful. - There is currently no easy way to view the health of the openstack environment. Providing the ability to view the location, run status, and versions of all the kolla containers would be very useful. While this could be done via the CLI, it is not optimal in environments with a large number of containers. Providing access to this via a REST API makes it possible to have a GUI to view the deployment health of the entire environment. - Many users find it desirable to make modifications to the service configuration files. This is an odd thing to try to do in a CLI and since they are a bit spread out (not all config files have augmentation files under /etc/kolla), it would be nice to provide a REST API to list, fetch and update the various files. - Some of the information that users are interested in is very difficult to represent clearly via a CLI and may want to be interacted with programmatically. One example is the Ansible variable data. Both inheritance and jinja2 processing factor into the value of our Ansible variables at run time. Representing what a variable's value is, and how it came to be what it is in CLI output is not pretty. A REST API will make it easier to give clients access to complex data sets. - There has been interest shown in having an easier way to manage multiple kolla environments. Providing a REST API which could be called via a remote CLI (or some other program) makes it easier to control multiple kolla environments. - There is no mechanism to provide a GUI to monitor/manage the openstack containers deployment. A GUI would require an API to provide the business logic to perform the features listed above. While this blueprint does not address building a GUI, it is a requirement for any GUI to be developed to manage the kolla environment. - Upgrades are complex. Users will want to selectively target upgrades to servers or groups of servers. When kolla support exists for it, they may also want to target upgrades to a particular service or set of services. This is very difficult to do correctly via ansible. Even with a CLI, it becomes difficult to manage. Having an API would allow a GUI to be developed to make it easier to manage upgrades. All the above could be done without a REST API. But it is very desirable to have a GUI to manage the above (or at a minimum provide a programmatic API to allow users to manage complex operations like upgrades). Proposed Change =============== - refactor the kollacli code to move all business logic into a common core to be shared between CLI and REST API. - Create WSGI webserver using pecan/paste. - The CLI will be able to run with or without the REST API. - Add controllers implementing the REST API Installation ------------ The REST API service could be installed by: - rpm - apt - docker container - some combination of the above As kolla is used to install openstack, there can be no dependency on any installed openstack service or packages. The actual installation mechanism is TBD. Security -------- Authentication will be provided by: - password authentication on web server using local account (PAM) - ldap (via PAM) - keystone Primary Assignees ----------------- - Borne Mace - Steve Noyes Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: mitaka Work Items ---------- - implement simple / initial REST API supporting current CLI commands - update CLI to work against REST service - update log gathering to be part of the REST service (separate tool right now) - support ldap & keystone authentication in the REST service. - add support for service template / service configuration modification - add support for service monitoring - add support for log viewing Testing ======= - write functional tests to cover REST API for single host and multi-hosts environment Documentation ============= - REST API Reference - REST API User's Guide

subject: Port IBM storewize_svc driver to Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-08 21:48:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/8133ad4aa3d9fa72922e3630b1ec8b1848d6af25', 'message': "Port IBM storewize_svc driver to Python 3

Change default preferred node in
StorwizeSVCDriver.initialize_connection(). For fiber channel without
multipath, sort the list of nodes and pick the first node, to have a
determinist preferred node. The list of nodes is created indirectly
using list(set(nodes)) which doesn't have a determinist order. On
Python 3, the hash function is randomized, and so list(set()) has an
unknown order.

A similar change was done for volume throttling in the change
Icf7141f772397c7ac08f0f1e21ad74cb86a06351 to port the code
to Python 3.

Other changes:

* Use list(set()) in test_storwize_svc to get the expected order on
  Python 3 (the hash function is randomized on Python 3).
* StorwizeSVCDriver._check_volume_copy_ops(): replace dict.items()
  with list(dict.items()) to iterate on items. On Python 3,
  dict.items() now returns a view instead of a copy. The loop
  modifies the dictionary and a dict must not be modified while
  iterating on it, we really need a copy of items.
* StorwizeHelpers: replace a/b with a//b to use integer division on
  Python 3.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_storwize_svc

Change-Id: I534a85928816d6cce921545e1820311aedd1b884

commit_message:
Port IBM storewize_svc driver to Python 3

Change default preferred node in
StorwizeSVCDriver.initialize_connection(). For fiber channel without
multipath, pick the first node from the list of sorted nodes, to have
a determinist preferred node. The list of nodes is created indirectly
using list(set(nodes)) which doesn't have a determinist order. On
Python 3, the hash function is randomized, and so list(set()) has an
unknown order.

A similar change was done for volume throttling in the change
Icf7141f772397c7ac08f0f1e21ad74cb86a06351 to port the code
to Python 3.

Other changes:

* Use assertSetEqual() in test_storwize_svc to compare
  initiator_target_map, because conn_wwpns has a random order on
  Python 3.
* StorwizeSVCDriver._check_volume_copy_ops(): replace dict.items()
  with list(dict.items()) to iterate on items. On Python 3,
  dict.items() now returns a view instead of a copy. The loop
  modifies the dictionary and a dict must not be modified while
  iterating on it, we really need a copy of items.
* StorwizeHelpers: replace a/b with a//b to use integer division on
  Python 3.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_storwize_svc

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I534a85928816d6cce921545e1820311aedd1b884

commit_message:
Use oslo_config new type PortOpt for port options

The oslo_config library provides new type PortOpt to validate the
range of port now.

Note, rpc_zmq_max_port is a socket port upper limit, so leave it untouched.

Change-Id: Icac28141bcb09e2b894662de1a6497766351919d
Closes-Bug: #1518256

commit_message:
Make zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints safe for post

Extend zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints to infer a target branch from
$ZUUL_REFNAME when $ZUUL_BRANCH is not present. This works around
the absence of branch guidance for ref-updated triggers in post
pipeline jobs, where Zuul is not told a branch but Gerrit instead
uses the branch as the refname for the event.

Change-Id: I3fd06cc1f09847f6731f80deb00fd1515f0106e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/86/249986/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export BRANCH=${ZUUL_BRANCH:-$ZUUL_REFNAME} --branch=$BRANCH \

commit_message:
Add 'hw:cpu_threads_policy=avoid' filtering

The 'avoid' CPU threads policy prevents guests from being scheduled
onto hosts utilising SMT technologies, such as Intel Hyper-Threading
Technology. SMT provides performance benefits, but comes at the cost
of reduced determinism. This makes it unsuitable for some workloads
were such determinism is critical, e.g. NFV.

Add support for this 'avoid' CPU threads policy filter. This is
achieved through the use of the NUMA topology filter.

Change-Id: I7fc87755e1035bd5dd31bfd334213e41829bea2d
Implements: blueprint virt-driver-cpu-thread-pinning

commit_message:
Remove AuxAddresses from the required properties

This patch removes AuxAddresses in IPv4Data and IPv6Data in the request
against /NetworkDriver.CreateNetwork. It can not be given if it's not
specified by the CLI rather than it's set to an empty JSON object.

Change-Id: I5a36fa78adee09d91c19d533bfcf660109a0ec21
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1519260

commit_message:
Add Warning when we cannot notify

Calling Notifier.audit() won't work with LogDriver as the
logger does not have a audit level anymore, So let's at
least not fail silently and let the operators know that
we are dropping stuff on the floor.

Closes-Bug: #1518170
Change-Id: I74002c72e6763ea8b5df7d97d722619bd4a1950b

commit_message:
Default for root_helper config

This sets the default for root_helper config to the value used
by ironic: 'sudo ironic-rootwrap /etc/ironic/rootwrap.conf'.

The logic was changed a bit so as not to pass root_helper or
run_as_root arguments to processutils.execute() unless they
had been specified or needed to be passed.

Change-Id: I8cf8c07102d0a8bd4fff14afc8c2f9db6beeb949
Fixes-Bug: #1519870

commit_message:
Print the JJB template name in devstack jobs

There are a lot of devstack jobs based on a lot of very similarly
named templates.  Have the jobs print out the template name at the
start to make tracking down the actual definition easier.

Change-Id: I059735cfc7f9cd43a81650675917bdc8c3d129f5
Depends-On: I1cfed9c27a58b45ba48aeed04839bfc8f54a831e

commit_message:
Fix resource leak in test_compute

Depending on the time between the create_server() and
delete_server() calls, it's possible the delete does not
actually find the server we want to delete, so we leave
instances hanging around after our tests. Fix this by waiting
for the servers with wait=True to create_server().

Change-Id: I908fdb94dcf5e410597a7cd3ecc6c962f2bfbce3

commit_message:
Declare multiattach is True in RBD driver

An RBD volume can be attached to multi instances, however,
this feature is not declared in RBD driver. As a result,
if a user create a multi-attached volume using RBD as
backend, they will be failed.

In this commit, we declared multiattach is True in RBD
driver.

Change-Id: I70c2c0528d9c00629f9cf34d79262a5bf4750e34
Closes-Bug: #1519227

commit_message:
Clean up compute functional tests

Although the server names being created were actually unique
across tests, this change will make the test_compute.py code
more consistent with other functional test code by creating
a server name prefix string with getUniqueString(). This also
opens the door for use across new tests.

It also changes the server cleanup code to just call
delete_server() with the name of the instance for the test.
Since tests can run in parallel, we don't want to delete an
instance with a similar name out from under some other test.

Change-Id: I1b0dc3f2759f77b7d420e45b3a7a2730868e6eb0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/44/249444/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from shade.exc import OpenStackCloudException self.server_prefix = self.getUniqueString('server') exception_list = list() for i in self.cloud.list_servers(): if i.name.startswith(self.server_prefix): try: self.cloud.delete_server(i.id) except Exception as e: exception_list.append(str(e)) continue if exception_list: raise OpenStackCloudException('\n'.join(exception_list)) server_name = self.server_prefix + '_create_server' server = self.cloud.create_server(name=server_name, self.assertEquals(server['name'], server_name) server_name = self.server_prefix + '_delete_server' self.cloud.create_server(name=server_name, image=self.image, flavor=self.flavor, wait=True) server_deleted = self.cloud.delete_server(server_name,

subject: Unexpected exception on tox test output on non-error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-07 19:40:35.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/util/event_simulator.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/f2dbd29e6850722da6b890a5f041688355d8ca0c', 'message': 'Unexpected exception on tox test output on non-error

When the co-routine invoked by the event_simulator throws an exception
it was being spit out to the stdout. This exception on a non-error is
confusing. The proposed change will enable an exception handler in the
event_simulator (which was commented out) and catch the exception and
push it to the log file.

Change-Id: I7633ded724f30836b2c5bd471d305f57ab04ce4d
Closes-Bug: #1378083
'}]
commit_message:
Unexpected exception on tox test output on non-error

When the co-routine invoked by the event_simulator throws an exception
it was being spit out to the stdout. This exception on a non-error is
confusing. The proposed change will enable an exception handler in the
event_simulator (which was commented out) and catch the exception and
push it to the log file.

Change-Id: I7633ded724f30836b2c5bd471d305f57ab04ce4d
Closes-Bug: #1378083
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/98/126698/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import traceback except Exception as e: print("Exception in coroutine! %s" % e) print("%s" % traceback.format_exc())
deleted_lines: # except Exception as e: # print("Exception in coroutine! %s" % e)

subject: Updates the update_user_attributes functionality
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-30 09:40:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/3e3558413656bdf73cf4144d2bb84a34e414544e', 'message': "Clears the database access for old user

Reasons:
- While using update-user-attributes to change the user's name or host access
  the old access to the databases remain as it is.
- There is a need to remove those old access so that any new user created with
  identical name does not get that previous existing access.

Changes:
- Added the query to delete the needful records from mysql.db for database access
- Executing the access-clearing query while update-user-attributes
  if either of user name or host is update.

Change-Id: Id87da96363d3cb932e6a92a611eebb054897a409
Closes-Bug: #1380880

commit_message:
Updates the update_user_attributes functionality

Reasons:
- While using update-user-attributes to change the user's name
  or host access the old access to the databases is left behind.
- The correct way to update user or host name is to use RENAME USER.

Changes:
- Updated statements to use "RENAME USER" for renaming the
  username or hostname.
- Updated statements to use "SET PASSWORD FOR" for changing passwords.
- Unit tests updated for sql_query.py
- Integration tests added to test the intended functionality for
  (user/host)-name updation.

Change-Id: Id87da96363d3cb932e6a92a611eebb054897a409
Closes-Bug: #1380880

commit_message:
Update: clean keepalived and radvd instances after pcs cluster stop

Older neutron versions have a bug which makes them leave keepalived and
radvd running even after all neutron services are stopped, preventing
neutron router failover from happening. Router can then get stuck on the
inactive node, like this:

[stack@instack ~]$ neutron l3-agent-list-hosting-router default_router
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| id                                   | host                               | admin_state_up | alive | ha_state |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+
| 48ca9477-b93b-4305-9e6d-9f1c5d3388f0 | overcloud-controller-1.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| eba0575c-654f-4da6-b1cd-f7fdf1cd3726 | overcloud-controller-2.localdomain | True           | :-)   | standby  |
| 68815390-251f-4425-a5f8-38bdbf3bdb90 | overcloud-controller-0.localdomain | True           | xxx   | active   |
+--------------------------------------+------------------------------------+----------------+-------+----------+

We need to kill the leftover processes manually to prevent the state
described above from happening.

See https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/248931

Change-Id: I2deaa176222983daa0c33ab52a6aa5dbe7365302
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/71/249171/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # clean leftover keepalived and radvd instances from neutron kill $(ps ax | grep -e "keepalived.*\.pid-vrrp" | awk '{print $1}') 2>/dev/null || : kill $(ps ax | grep -e "radvd.*\.pid\.radvd" | awk '{print $1}') 2>/dev/null || :

subject: Corrects INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS for MySQL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-16 08:17:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/a668ee473acee74db473bd3ea85e7b82c023c312', 'message': 'Corrects INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS for MySQL

Reasons:
- Currently the value of INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">=".
- Because of this when matching the database name it results in
  name >= value, which results in more than needed values and
  the sorting mechanism then may return the other value similar
  to one matched as explained in bug.

Changes:
- Corrects the value for INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">="
  to INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means "=",
  so that only matched value is returned.
- Updated the tests for matching the resulting query.

commit_message:
Corrects INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS for MySQL

Reasons:
- Currently the value of INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">=".
- Because of this when matching the database name it results in
  name >= value, which results in more than needed values and
  the sorting mechanism then may return the other value similar
  to one matched as explained in bug.

Changes:
- Corrects the value for INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means ">="
  to INCLUDE_MARKER_OPERATORS[True] means "=",
  so that only matched value is returned.
- Updated the tests for matching the resulting query.

Change-Id: Ia197b007917f1b5f9f681e0d2d749489235052be
Closes-Bug: #1316717

deleted_lines: self.assertTrue(("AND schema_name >= '%s'" % marker) in args[0].text) self.assertTrue("AND Marker >= '" + marker + "'" in args[0].text)

commit_message:
Add percona int-test group

Reasons:
 - As you know, Percona is another flavor of MySQL
   community distro, and in Trove its integration
   part works with shared mysql driver.

Closes-Bug: #1417518

commit_message:
User management for Vertica clusters and instances

As the spec specifies, changes were made to enable user
CRUD operations for Vertica clusters and instances.n the trove
client. Depending on whether its an instance or a cluster, the
user operations are performed. Unit tests for the user
operations for clusters are also added.

Implements blueprint: cluster-user-management

Change-Id: Ic6367bae2f2cf8f3cfea4b858376e1073d8b6fbc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/22/195322/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create(self, is_cluster, instance, users): if is_cluster: url = "/clusters/%s/users" % base.getid(instance) else: url = "/instances/%s/users" % base.getid(instance) def delete(self, is_cluster, instance, username, hostname=None): if is_cluster: url = "/clusters/%s/users/%s" % (base.getid(instance), user) else: url = "/instances/%s/users/%s" % (base.getid(instance), user) def list(self, is_cluster, instance, limit=None, marker=None): if is_cluster: url = "/clusters/%s/users" % base.getid(instance) else: url = "/instances/%s/users" % base.getid(instance) def get(self, is_cluster, instance, username, hostname=None): if is_cluster: url = "/clusters/%s/users/%s" % (base.getid(instance), user) else: url = "/instances/%s/users/%s" % (base.getid(instance), user) def update_attributes(self, is_cluster, instance, username, newuserattr=None, hostname=None): if is_cluster: url = "/clusters/%s/users/%s" % (base.getid(instance), user) else: url = "/instances/%s/users/%s" % (base.getid(instance), user)
deleted_lines: def create(self, instance, users): url = "/instances/%s/users" % base.getid(instance) def delete(self, instance, username, hostname=None): url = "/instances/%s/users/%s" % (base.getid(instance), user) def list(self, instance, limit=None, marker=None): url = "/instances/%s/users" % base.getid(instance) def get(self, instance, username, hostname=None): url = "/instances/%s/users/%s" % (base.getid(instance), user) def update_attributes(self, instance, username, newuserattr=None, hostname=None): instance_id = base.getid(instance) url = "/instances/%s/users/%s" % (instance_id, user)

commit_message:
Use datastore specific timeouts if they exists

Reasons:
- If one taskmanager is managing multiple datastores it becomes
  mandatory to setup the usage_timeout/cluster_usage_timeout
  to be the highest value to accommodate highest time-taking datastore.

Changes:
- Updates taskamanager to use datastore-specific usage_timeout,
  if one exists, otherwise use the default one.
- Updates mongodb and vertica cluster strategies to use
  datastore-specific cluster_usage_timeout, if one exists,
  otherwise use the default one.
- Updated usage_timeout from mysql and percona confs to be 600,
  as the integration tests do not work with previous value of 400 seconds.

Closes-Bug: #1432558
Closes-Bug: #1469989
Change-Id: If78dead1ea013ed7a807b4a9327056092ff7012a

commit_message:
Stop using nova client in test_compute

The test_compute functional test code was using nova client
directly instead of the shade API. Let's avoid that.

Change-Id: Iac5650a036f006cf3d30ff44086d348cba7c303f
